attributes.action: Please stop passing the law requiring after school religious classes to register
attributes.additional_details:
Studies have shown that the people who have a poor religious education are radicalised. This includes a study by MI5’s Behavioural Sciences Unit which concluded the following about potential radicals:
-A large number do not practise their faith regularly
-Very few have been brought up in strongly religious households.
-There is evidence that a well-established religious identity actually protects against violent radicalisation.
(http://www.theguardian.com/uk/2008/aug/20/uksecurity.terrorism1)
attributes.background: We urge the govt. to halt these plans due to their counter-productive nature, and to evaluate whether a link really exists between supplementary religious schooling and radicalisation. The proposals can have significant impacts upon ordinary British people, their children and religious institutions.
